summary.para: Contains the new global debug configuration for XAudio2. Used with the function.

remarks.para: Debugging messages can be completely turned off by initializing XAUDIO2_DEBUG_CONFIGURATION to all zeroes.
Note For this version of XAudio2, only the XAUDIO2_LOG_ERRORS value is supported on TraceMask or BreakMask. All other members and values are ignored.
Windows 10 (XAudio2.9); Windows 8, Windows Phone 8 (XAudio 2.8); DirectX SDK (XAudio 2.7)

summary.para: Bitmask of enabled debug message types. Can be 0 or one or more of the following:

item.description: Log warning messages. Note Enabling XAUDIO2_LOG_WARNINGS also enables XAUDIO2_LOG_ERRORS.
Log detailed informational messages. Note Enabling XAUDIO2_LOG_DETAIL also enables XAUDIO2_LOG_INFO.
Log public API function entries and exits.
Log internal function entries and exits. Note Enabling XAUDIO2_LOG_FUNC_CALLS also enables XAUDIO2_LOG_API_CALLS.
Log delays detected and other timing data.
Log usage of critical sections and mutexes.

summary.para: Message types that will cause an immediate break. Can be 0 or one of the following:

item.description: Break on warning messages. Note Enabling XAUDIO2_LOG_WARNINGS also enables XAUDIO2_LOG_ERRORS.

summary.para: Indicates whether to log the thread ID with each message.
Indicates whether to log source files and line numbers.
Indicates whether to log function names.
Indicates whether to log message timestamps.
